tuv.seg: Consumer guide to buying a new car
Comhairle maidir le carr nua a cheannach
Generally, when you buy a new car you buy directly from a dealer or a garage
Go ginearálta nuair a cheannaíonn tú carr nua is ó dhíoltóir nó ó gharáiste a cheannaíonn tú é
You will have a consumer contract with this dealer or garage
Beidh conradh tomhaltóra agat leis an díoltóir nó leis an ngaráiste sin
Under this contract you have the right to buy a car that is of merchantable quality, as described and fit for its purpose
Faoin gconradh sin beidh sé de cheart agat carr a cheannach atá i riocht díola, de réir mar a chuirtear síos air agus é oiriúnach chun a chuid críocha
This means that if there is a fault with the car after you have bought it, the business with whom you have the contract (i.e
Ciallaíonn sé sin má bhíonn locht ar an gcarr tar éis duit é a cheannach, ní mór don ghnólacht lena bhfuil an conradh agat (i.e
the car dealer or garage) must put things right by either repairing the fault or replacing the car
an díoltóir cairr nó garáiste) rudaí a chur ina gceart tríd an locht a dheisiú nó trí carr eile a thabhairt duit
In an extreme situation they may also refund you the cost of the car
I gcás an-dona b’fhéidir go dtabharfaidís duit costas an chairr freisin
These rules apply only to someone buying a car for their own personal use from someone whose normal business it is to sell cars
Ní bhíonn feidhm leis na rialacha sin ach amháin i gcás daoine a cheannaíonn carranna dá n-úsáid phearsanta féin ó dhuine arb é a ghnáth ghnó é carranna a dhíol
If you buy a commercial vehicle (a van, a truck or a tractor) you may not have the same rights as when you buy a car for personal use
Má cheannaíonn tú feithicil thráchtála (veain, trucail nó tarracóir) b’fhéidir nach mbeadh na cearta céanna agat le nuair a cheannaíonn tú carr le haghaidh úsáid phearsanta a bhaint as
There are additional costs associated with buying a car which you should be aware of before you buy
Tá costais bhreise ag baint le carr a cheannach ba chóir a bheadh ar eolas agat sula gceannaíonn tú ceann
When budgeting for a car you should take into account that you will need to pay for motor insurance, motor tax, repairs and servicing as well as petrol/diesel
Nuair a bhíonn tú ag buiséadú le haghaidh carr a cheannach ba chóir smaoineamh go gcaithfidh tú íoc as árachas, cáin, deisiúcháin agus seirbhís a chur air chomh maith le peitreal/díosal
A car with a small engine will cost less to tax, insure and run so keep these factors in mind when you are buying
Ní bheidh carr le hinneall beag chomh daor le cáin, árachas a chur air ná é a choinneáil ag imeacht mar sin smaoinigh ar na nithe sin nuair a cheannaíonn tú carr
Often when you are buying a major item like a car you will need help to finance the purchase
Go minic nuair a cheannaíonn tú rud mór ar nós cairr beidh cúnamh ag teastáil uait chun an ceannachán a mhaoiniú
You may decide to buy a car on hire purchase or borrow money to help pay for the car
B’fhéidir go ndéanfá cinneadh carr a cheannach ar Fruilcheannach nó airgead a fháil ar iasacht chun cuidiú leat íoc as an gcarr
You should always shop around for the best deal and remember that there is more than one way to finance the cost of a new car
Ba chóir duit breathnú thart i gcónaí chun an margadh is fearr a fháil agus cuimhneamh go bhfuil níos mó ná bealach amháin ann chun costas cairr nua a mhaoiniú
Before getting a loan you should read the Competition and Consumer Protection Commission (CCPC) website on buying a car - your finance options
Sula bhfaigheann tú iasacht ba chóir duit an Coimisiún um Iomaíocht agus Cosaint Tomhaltóirí (CICT) láithreán gréasáin a léamh
If a garage or dealer is offering to arrange finance, they are acting as a credit intermediary and they may be earning commission by arranging your credit for you
Má bhíonn garáiste ag tairiscint maoiniú a shocrú beidh siad ag gníomhú mar eadránaí creidmheasa agus d’fhéadfaidís a bheith ag saothrú coimisiúin as do chreidmheas a shocrú duit
The CCPC regulates credit intermediaries and all credit intermediaries must hold an authorisation
Rialaíonn an Coimisiún um Iomaíocht agus Cosaint Tomhaltóirí eadránaithe creidmheasa agus caithfidh údarású a bheith ag gach eadránaí creidmheasa
Contact the CCPC to find out if the garage that you are dealing with is registered with them
Téigh i dteagmháil leis an CICT chun fáil amach an bhfuil an garáiste a raibh tú ag déileáil leis cláraithe leo
If you choose to buy a car on hire purchase ensure that you are getting a hire purchase deal and not a consumer hire agreement
Má roghnaíonn tú carr a cheannach ar Fruilcheannach cinntigh go bhfuil tú ag fáil margaidh fruilcheannaigh agus ní comhaontú fruile tomhaltóirí
When you buy a car on hire purchase ownership of the car passes to you only after you have paid the final instalment
Nuair a cheannaíonn tú carr ar Fruilcheannach ní bhíonn tusa i d’úinéir ar an gcarr go dtí go mbíonn an tráthchuid deiridh íoctha agat
In the case of consumer hire agreement ownership never passes to you
I gcás comhaontú Fruile Tomhaltóirí ní leatsa an carr go deo
After signing a credit agreement you have a ten-day cooling off period
Tar éis duit comhaontú creidmheasa a shíniú bíonn ‘tréimhse fuaraithe’ deich lá agat
Some garages may ask you to sign away this right but you should think carefully about this before you waive this right
B’fhéidir go n-iarrfadh roinnt garáistí ort an ceart sin a chur amú ach ba chóir duit smaoineamh go cúramach faoi sin sula dtarscaoileann tú an ceart sin
Legal requirements when buying a car
Ceanglais dlíthiúla chun carr a cheannach
If you import a car to Ireland or buy a new car in Ireland you need to ensure that your car is registered and you may be obliged to pay Vehicle Registration Tax
Má allmhairíonn tú carr go hÉirinn nó má cheannaíonn tú carr in Éirinn beidh ort a chinntiú go bhfuil an carr cláraithe agus b'fhéidir go mbeadh ort Cáin Cláraithe Feithicle a íoc
In addition you need to ensure that you have adequate motor insurance and you need to pay motor tax annually
Ina theannta sin caithfidh tú a chinntiú go mbeidh dóthain mótair-árachais agat agus beidh ort mótarcháin a íoc go bliantúil
You can find out more about what you need to do in our documents on buying a new car and importing a car into Ireland
Féadfaidh tú tuilleadh a fháil amach faoi cad a chaithfidh tú a dhéanamh nuair a cheannaíonn tú carr nua anseo
If you live in another country and wish to buy a car in Ireland you can register the car here temporarily
Má tá cónaí ort i dtír eile agus más mian leat carr a cheannach in Éirinn féadfaidh tú an carr a chlárú anseo go sealadach
You can read about the strict rules that apply to temporary vehicle registration here
Féadfaidh tú léamh faoi na rialacha diana a bhaineann le clárúchán feithicle sealadach anseo
All cars in Ireland need to reach a certain standard of safety and need to be roadworthy
Caithfidh gach carr in Éirinn caighdeán sábháilteachta ar leith a shroichint agus caithfidh siad a bheith sábháilte le dul chun bóthair
The National Car Test ensures that all vehicles meet certain standards
Cinntíonn an Tástáil Cairr Náisiúnta go gcomhlíonann gach feithicle caighdeáin áirithe
A new car will need to be tested once it has reached 4 years of age
Caithfear tástáil a chur ar charr nua nuair a bhíonn an carr 4 bliana d'aois
The first section of the label shows the emission bands and identifies the band for the particular vehicle to which a label is attached
Má cheannaíonn tú carr agus más mian leat é a thiomáint láithreach ba chóir duit a chinntiú go bhfuil an ceadúnas tiomána cuí agat don charr
Speedometers should show speeds in kilometres per hour
Ba chóir go léireodh luasmhéadar luas i gcileaméadar san uair
Since January 2005 all speed limits on road signs in Ireland are expressed in kilometres rather than miles
Ó Eanáir 2005 léirítear gach teorainn luais in Éirinn ar chomharthaí bóthair i gcileaméadair in áit mílte
Drivers need to know what their speed is in kilometres and most new vehicles sold measure speed in both miles per hour and kilometres per hour
Ní mór do thiománaithe fios a bheith acu cad é a luas i gcileaméadair agus tomhaiseann cuid mhaith carranna nua a dhíoltar an luas i mílte san uair agus i gcileaméadair san uair
Almost all new vehicles on the market since January 2005 have speedometers marked in kilometres per hour
Tá luasmhéadair marcáilte i gcileaméadair san uair i mbeagnach gach feithicle nua a chuir tionscail mótair na hÉireann ar an margadh ó Eanáir 2005
You may have an older car to trade-in and you should consider what different garages are offering for your car
B’fhéidir go bhfuil carr níos sine agat le trádáil isteach agus ba chóir duit smaoineamh ar cad atá na garáistí difriúla ag tairiscint do do charr
Again, shopping around for the best price for your trade-in car is the best option
Arís, is é an rogha is fearr agat ná cuartú thart chun an praghas is fearr a fháil ar an gcarr atá tú ag trádáil isteach
Get independent advice as to what your car is worth before trading it in
Faigh comhairle neamhspleách faoi luach do chairr sula dtrádálann tú isteach é
A garage or dealer is likely to pay less for it than it’s worth on the open market, as they have to cover costs in selling it on
Tá an baol ann go n-íocfaidh garáiste nó díoltóir níos lú air ná mar is fiú é ar an margadh oscailte, de bhrí go gcaithfidh siadsan costais chun é a dhíol arís a chlúdach
You may consider selling the car for a higher price by taking out a small advertisement in a newspaper
Má bhíonn am agat féadfaidh tú an carr a dhíol ar phraghas níos airde tú féin trí fhógra beag a chur i bpáipéar nuachta
If you have a problem with a new car that you have bought you should firstly bring the car back to the garage or dealer who should be able to repair any problems that you have

Má bhíonn fadhb agat le carr nua atá ceannaithe agat ba chóir duit, sa chéad dul síos, an carr a thabhairt ar ais chuig an ngaráiste nó díoltóir agus ba chóir go mbeidís in ann aon fhadhbanna a bheadh agat a dheisiú
New car distributors usually have comprehensive customer procedures to deal with customer problems
De ghnáth bíonn nósanna imeachtaí custaiméirí cuimsitheacha ag dáileoirí carranna nua chun déileáil le fadhbanna custaiméirí
Further advice may be sought from the Society of the Irish Motor Industry
Is féidir comhairle bhreise a fháil ó Chumann Thionscal Mótar na hÉireann
It has also published A Guide to Buying a Car (pdf) for consumers purchasing new or second-hand cars which is available on its website or by phoning its helpline
Tabharfaidh an Coimisiún um Iomaíocht agus Cosaint Tomhaltóirí eolas duit freisin ar na cearta atá agat sa chás go dteastaíonn sé uait
